column3: Baldur's Gate III is a role-playing game situated within the established universe of the Forgotten Realms. The story unfolds around a group of characters who become infected by a parasitic tadpole, threatening to turn them into Mind Flayers, a dreaded and alien species known for their psionic abilities and power over other creatures. This central conflict serves as a catalyst, drawing the characters into a grander plot that spans diverse regions and encounters with various factions.Players can either choose the pre-designed Origin characters or craft their own from a selection of races and classes typical of Dungeons & Dragons lore, such as elves, dwarves, wizards, and rogues, among others. The gameplay emphasizes turn-based tactical combat, where players must strategically deploy their party members on the battlefield, leveraging their unique abilities and spells. Additionally, decision-making and character interactions play significant roles, with player choices leading to varying narrative outcomes, affecting not only the story's progression but also relationships with party members and other NPCs.A notable feature is its adherence to many Dungeons & Dragons mechanics, translating the tabletop experience into a digital format. Dice-rolling, a staple of the D&D system, is integral to many actions and decisions in the game, introducing elements of chance and unpredictability. Environments in the game are highly interactive, allowing players to exploit them for strategic benefits during encounters. Furthermore, the game provides the option for cooperative play, letting multiple players navigate the narrative and challenges together.

column1: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom
column3: The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom is an action game and a direct sequel to 2017's The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild. It retains much of its predecessor's gameplay style, setting, and mechanics while adding significant new content and abilities.The game is set in Hyrule, a few years after the events of Breath of the Wild. Players control Link, a young warrior who must once again rescue Princess Zelda and thwart the plans of Ganondorf, the main antagonist. The story focuses on the upheaval of Hyrule following the reawakening of a powerful force beneath Hyrule Castle, an event called the “Upheaval” - which causes massive chasms to appear across the land and islands to rise into the sky.Exploration plays a central role in Tears of the Kingdom. Players can travel across Hyrule’s surface, the Sky Islands above it, and the Depths below. The game’s world is vast and largely non-linear, allowing players to pursue quests, solve puzzles, and discover hidden locations at their own pace. The game introduces numerous new abilities for Link, such as Ultrahand, which lets him manipulate and combine objects; Fuse, which merges items to create powerful weapons and gear; Ascend, allowing him to pass upward through solid structures; and Recall, a power that reverses an object's movement in time.The game also expands upon the mechanics of its predecessor by adding extensive crafting and vehicle-building. Players can use materials and components to construct vehicles, gliders, and contraptions to navigate the world in creative ways. The map itself evolves from Breath of the Wild, featuring revamped locations alongside entirely new areas in the sky and underground.The story is presented through a combination of cut-scenes, quests, and collectible memories, adding depth to the relationships between the main characters and the history of Hyrule. The main quest typically guides players toward key locations, but the game's structure emphasizes exploration and freedom of approach.

Astro Bot is a 3D mascot platformer and action game developed exclusively for PlayStation 5. Released on September 6, 2024, in celebration of PlayStation’s 30th anniversary, it marks the first Astro title developed after the spin-off of Team Asobi from Japan Studio. The game builds upon Astro's Playroom (2020), and included title for the PS5, but expands dramatically in scope and content.Players embark on a galaxy-spanning quest as Astro, launching from his shattered PS5 mothership in pursuit of scattered crew bots, while also recovering parts to rebuild the vessel and stopping the alien villain Nebulax. The platforming journey spans over 50 planets across six galaxies, each crafted with unique mechanics and environmental themes. Astro gains access to inventive power-ups, such as a dog jetpack, shrink/mouse form, air-dash, grappling glove, and giant sponge - all delivered through fluid, responsive controls enhanced by DualSense haptics and 4K visuals.

Metroid Prime: Remastered is a first-person action game that updates the original Metroid Prime for the Nintendo Switch with overhauled visuals, refined controls, and new accessibility options. Players once again step into the role of interstellar bounty hunter Samus Aran, exploring the planet Tallon IV after receiving a distress signal from a derelict space vessel. The story unfolds through exploration, combat, and environmental scanning, as Samus investigates the ruins of the ancient Chozo civilization and confronts the threat of the Space Pirates and their genetic experiments.The core gameplay blends exploration with combat and puzzle-solving. Players navigate interconnected environments, unlocking new areas by acquiring upgrades such as the Morph Ball, Grapple Beam, and various beam weapons. Combat emphasizes a lock-on targeting system that allows players to circle enemies while firing, with boss encounters testing both reflexes and the creative use of Samus’s expanding arsenal. Environmental storytelling is enhanced by the Scan Visor, which provides lore, hints, and tactical data.This remastered edition features high-definition textures, reworked lighting, and redesigned models that bring Tallon IV and its creatures to life with more detail than ever before. Controls include a modern dual-analog option, a pointer-style scheme reminiscent of the Wii release, and a “classic” setup inspired by the GameCube original. Additional features include a new casual difficulty mode that reduces incoming damage, as well as unlockable galleries with concept art, 3D models, and music from both the original release and the remaster. Metroid Prime: Remastered preserves the structure and pacing of the original while presenting it with modern enhancements for both returning players and newcomers to the series.

Elden Ring is a dark fantasy action role-playing game that blends open-world exploration with challenging combat. Designed by Hidetaka Miyazaki with worldbuilding by George R. R. Martin, the game invites players to assume the role of a Tarnished on a quest to restore the Elden Ring and claim the title of Elden Lord in the enigmatic realm of the Lands Between.Gameplay is set in a seamless open world divided into distinct regions such as Limgrave, Caelid, and the Altus Plateau. Players explore on foot or atop a spectral mount named Torrent, unlocking Sites of Grace for fast travel. Combat builds on FromSoftware’s established systems, offering a mix of melee, ranged, and sorcery options, along with mechanics like stealth, mounted combat, and guard counters. Progression comes through leveling stats, finding new equipment, and acquiring Ashes of War to customize weapon skills. The game embraces minimal guidance, offering no minimap and sparse waypoint hints; players must chart their course through discovery, courage, and resourcefulness.Distinctive features include its non-linear structure and emphasis on discovery - players can tackle major objectives in varied order, uncover dozens of optional dungeons, or pursue hidden questlines with branching outcomes. The Lands Between is populated with hundreds of weapons, spells, and craftable items, alongside collectible Spirit Ashes that summon allies in battle. Cooperative and competitive online play allow players to summon help, duel invaders, or leave messages for others, extending the game’s dynamic, interconnected world design.

Metaphor: ReFantazio is a role-playing game with a gothic-fantasy aesthetic that combines traditional turn-based combat with streamlined social simulation mechanics. While it shares structural similarities with previous Atlus games like Persona and Shin Megami Tensei, it introduces new gameplay systems and design improvements that emphasize both strategic flexibility and narrative immersion.The game is set in the Kingdom of Euchronia, a politically unstable realm where players take on the role of a young man unexpectedly drawn into a magical election to determine the nation’s next ruler. The passage of time is central to gameplay, using a calendar system that divides each day into segments. Players must carefully manage how they spend their time—balancing dungeon exploration, social activities, and story progression. Unlike earlier Atlus titles, Metaphor reduces downtime and filler, resulting in a more focused pacing aligned with the urgency of the game's events.A refined version of the Persona series’ social systems appears in the form of Bond and Royal Virtue mechanics. These track relationships and personal growth with greater transparency, allowing players to make informed choices about how and when to level up specific attributes. These systems reinforce the central theme of building trust and unity, as players connect with a diverse cast of characters across various regions and social backgrounds.Combat is turn-based and deeply strategic, drawing on the press-turn system known from Shin Megami Tensei. Players and enemies gain additional actions by exploiting elemental weaknesses, rewarding careful planning and adaptability. The game's standout feature is the Archetype system—a flexible job system where characters can adopt various roles and retain skills across multiple classes. Archetypes can be mixed within the party to unlock powerful Synthesis attacks, which consume multiple turn icons to execute high-impact moves or special support abilities. This system encourages experimentation and thoughtful party composition.To complement its turn-based structure, Metaphor also includes real-time elements. Players can engage weaker enemies with action-based attacks to bypass traditional battles, making exploration more efficient. Combat-related progression is supported by generous item distribution, enabling players to level up Archetypes even outside of battle. This reduces grinding and promotes consistent development throughout the game.The game features a dynamic world map, traversed using the Gauntlet Runner—a mobile, steampunk-inspired hub that functions as both a travel method and a place to train characters, develop bonds, and prepare for the next phase of the journey. This supports the game's globe-trotting narrative and keeps players constantly moving through new regions and challenges.Optional dungeons and sidequests offer additional gameplay depth. These areas contain stronger enemies, rare rewards, and opportunities to explore character stories or fulfill requests from NPCs. They also provide experience points and social progression.

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is a role-playing game set in a surreal, painterly world. It centers on the inhabitants of the island of Lumière, who annually endure a supernatural event called the "Gommage". During this event, a mysterious entity known as the Paintress awakens and paints a number on her monolith. All people of that age immediately vanish, seemingly erased from existence. In response to this phenomenon, the citizens of Lumière send yearly expeditions to defeat the Paintress and end the cycle of death. The game follows the journey of one such expedition, known as Expedition 33.Gameplay is structured around turn-based combat augmented by real-time elements. Players engage in battles that incorporate timing-based actions for dodging, parrying, and executing attacks. The system emphasizes rhythm and reaction, drawing comparisons to both traditional Japanese RPGs and rhythm-based mechanics. Each character in the player's party possesses a unique combat system, requiring different strategies and skill sets. Additional customization is available through weapon affinities, stat scaling, and the use of equippable modifiers called "Pictos", which provide passive buffs and enhancements that can be permanently learned and shared across the party.The game’s world is explored via a traditional overworld map, with linear dungeons and occasional side paths. While exploration is limited compared to open-world RPGs, the design focuses on visual detail and narrative atmosphere. The environments range from sunlit forests and submerged cities to abstract and surreal locations such as gothic ship graveyards and forgotten battlefields.Narratively, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 delves into themes of death, legacy, and the cyclical nature of trauma. The plot follows a group of survivors from the failed Expedition 33, including Gustave, Maelle, Lune, and Sciel, as they attempt to reach and destroy the Paintress. After an early ambush by a mysterious White-Haired Man, much of the expedition is killed, prompting the survivors to traverse the continent in search of a way to breach the Paintress's defenses. They are later joined by Verso, a former member of Expedition 00, and his companions Monoco and Esquie. Over time, the party uncovers deeper truths about the Paintress, the origin of the Gommage, and their own identities.Visually, the game is notable for its painterly art direction, expressive character models, and melancholic tone. It represents a stylistic and mechanical fusion of influences from classic JRPGs such as Final Fantasy and Persona, action-RPG elements akin to Dark Souls, and rhythm-based gameplay.

God of War: Ragnarök is an action game and the sequel to God of War (2018). It is the ninth installment in the series and concludes the Norse era. The game is set in ancient Scandinavia and once again features series protagonist, Kratos, and his now teenage son, Atreus. It covers Ragnarök, the eschatological event which is central to Norse mythology and was foretold to happen in the previous game.It retains the core gameplay structure of its predecessor, combining combo-based melee combat, puzzle-solving, and exploration within a semi-open world. The game is presented from an over-the-shoulder perspective and features a continuous-shot camera with no loading screens or scene cuts.The player primarily controls Kratos, who utilizes three main weapons: the Leviathan Axe (infused with ice magic), the Blades of Chaos (fire-infused chain blades), and the newly introduced Draupnir Spear (a wind-based spear that can multiply and detonate). Each weapon includes light and heavy attacks, runic magical abilities, and can be used for both combat and environmental interaction. A new gameplay mechanic allows weapons to be used in traversal—such as using the blades as a grappling tool—and to perform plunging attacks from elevated positions. Shields are more customizable in Ragnarök, with different types offering offensive or defensive capabilities. The Spartan Rage ability has been expanded into three modes—Fury, Valor, and Wrath—offering distinct combat and healing effects.Combat has been expanded to include a greater variety of enemy types compared to the previous game, such as einherjar, wyverns, phantoms, stalkers, nøkkens, and human raiders. The inclusion of additional mini-bosses and varied enemy behaviors was intended to enhance gameplay diversity.While Kratos remains the primary playable character, Ragnarök introduces segments where the player assumes full control of Atreus. These story-driven sections feature Atreus's unique combat style, including ranged attacks with a magical bow, melee combos, summoning spectral animals, and his own transformation-based rage abilities. Throughout the game, Kratos is accompanied by AI-controlled companions—primarily Atreus but also other characters in different story chapters. These companions assist in combat, exploration, and puzzles, and can be directed to perform specific actions.The game incorporates RPG elements, including gear customization, crafting, and skill progression. Weapons and armor can be upgraded using collected resources. Ragnarök introduces armor transmog, allowing players to change the visual appearance of armor sets without affecting their stats. A variety of side quests and optional exploration content are available, expanding the game's scope beyond the central narrative.

Resident Evil 4 is a survival-horror game reimagining the 2005 original, Resident Evil 4, through modernized mechanics and visuals. Players control Leon S. Kennedy, who must rescue the president’s daughter, Ashley Graham, from a cult in rural Spain - revisiting this narrative with expanded characterization and updated environmental storytelling.Gameplay maintains the familiar over-the-shoulder camera and action-horror pacing of the original, while introducing new mechanics and quality-of-life systems. Inventory remains via the attache case, now complemented by crafting for weapons and ammo. Leon gains mobility improvements  - moving while aiming and reloading, and melee combat benefits from knife parry mechanics, melees like kicks or suplexes, and knife durability. The merchant returns with added side-quests, the removal of quick-time events for many boss encounters, and crouch-enabled stealth possibilities.Distinctive features of the remake include enhanced AI and enemy behavior for more tense combat, redesigned environments with expanded exploration, and modernized presentation through dynamic lighting, atmospheric audio, and detailed character models.

Hollow Knight: Silksong is a 2D action Metroidvania game. It is the sequel to the 2017 Hollow Knight. The game takes place in Pharloom, a new insect kingdom distinct from Hallownest, the setting of the first game. Pharloom is depicted as a land of verticality, with regions such as mossy caverns, gilded cities, moors, crypts, and a citadel at the kingdom's peak. The world is populated by both friendly non-player characters and hostile creatures.The protagonist is Hornet, a recurring character from the original game. At the beginning of the story, Hornet is captured and taken to Pharloom. Her journey is described as a pilgrimage through the kingdom, where she seeks to ascend to the citadel and uncover mysteries tied to her origin and the land’s history. The narrative expands through environmental storytelling, quests from various inhabitants, and lore tied to Pharloom’s culture of silk and song.Hollow Knight: Silksong retains the core structure of a Metroidvania game, with interconnected areas, ability-based progression, and non-linear exploration. Hornet's movement set emphasizes agility and speed, with expanded acrobatic actions compared to the Knight from the previous title. Players can perform swift melee attacks, backsteps, and aerial maneuvers. Healing is tied to Silk, a resource Hornet accumulates and spends to restore health or perform special abilities.Exploration features platforming, puzzles, and quests given by characters across Pharloom. Players can craft tools, traps, and mechanisms to aid exploration or combat. The game introduces a quest system where side objectives are tracked and can influence the state of the world.The game includes over 200 enemy types and more than 40 bosses. Enemies range from beasts and hunters to mechanical constructs, while bosses are designed as major encounters tied to story progression or optional challenges. Defeating enemies rewards materials and items that contribute to crafting and upgrades.In addition to the standard campaign, the game features a Steel Soul mode, a permadeath variant returning from the first Hollow Knight. The game maintains the hand-drawn, 2D art style of its predecessor.

Split Fiction is a co-operative action game where two players take on the roles of Mio and Zoe, two writers with contrasting styles—one sci-fi, the other fantasy. After being connected to a machine designed to steal their creative ideas, they find themselves trapped within their own stories. To escape and retain their memories, they must rely on each other, mastering diverse abilities and overcoming challenges as they jump between sci-fi and fantasy worlds. This co-op action-adventure emphasizes unexpected moments and teamwork, requiring players to adapt to wildly different scenarios, from taming dragons to battling as cyber ninjas. The game has 8 chapters with various sub-levels within those chapters.The co-op element is central to the gameplay experience, with many challenges designed to be overcome through teamwork. One player might distract an enemy while the other sneaks past, or combine their abilities to create powerful combo attacks. As the adventure progresses, players unlock new abilities and story branches, allowing for multiple playthroughs with different outcomes based on their choices and cooperative strategies.This game is co-op multiplayer only. There is no single-player mode, and it is not possible to finish the game unless a second player is present. As was the case with It Takes Two, when connecting via online multiplayer, only the host needs to own the game, while the joining player can use the Friend's Pass - a free version of the game that can only connect to players who have purchased the full version.

Balatro is a strategic card game with a roguelike structure influenced by the Cantonese card game Big Two and Luck be a Landlord. A game is played as a run that is different every time because of various parameters and random elements. It is up to the player to organize and enhance a standard deck of 52 cards to complete the run, which ends the game. During runs various elements are unlocked permanently, but as is typical for a roguelike, most of the items and progress are lost as soon as the run is over, whether it was completed successfully or not. A run is divided into multiple steps called Blinds with a limited number of hands. If a Blind cannot be completed because the requirements are not met, the game is over right away.Scoring in the game is based around the standard hands of the Poker such as a high card, a pair, a flush or a full house. There are however a lot of game elements that add to the strategy. There is a cash system where money between Blinds can be spent on new cards and card modifications. For instance, both individual cards and hands can be upgraded, making a pair earn more than a straight. The standard deck can contain enhanced cards of various types, but players can also destroy cards, removing them permanently, or introduce new cards. That way, it is for instance possible to get rid of some Jacks and replace them with additional aces instead. Unlike as is common in most deck building games, it is possible to run out of cards in a single Blind when all of them have been dealt.Other game elements are Joker cards that provide bonuses and multipliers and single-use tarot cards that can be used at specific moments for a strategic advantage. In the third and final Blind of a round the player is often challenged to work around certain restrictions, such as hidden cards, debuffed cards or only allowing a specific hand to be played.The roguelike structure is further deepened by unlocking specific starting decks and multiple difficulties. Many game elements are also only unlocked over time, as more Joker cards are added to the starting pool.

Like a Dragon: Infinite Wealth is a Japanese role-playing game (JRPG) that blends modern turn-based combat with open-world exploration and vibrant character-driven storytelling. It follows dual protagonists - Ichiban Kasuga and Kazuma Kiryu - on parallel journeys that span familiar districts in Japan and the sun-soaked shores of Honolulu.Gameplay unfolds in sprawling, living environments such as Yokohama's Isezaki Ijincho, Tokyo, and Honolulu. Players can explore on foot or via Segway as they engage in a refined turn-based battle system, known as the “Live Command RPG” Battle System. This system allows characters to move freely during combat within positional rings - enabling strategic placement for knockbacks, tag-team attacks, and positional bonuses depending on enemy proximity and environmental interaction.Distinctive features include the cinematic expansion into Honolulu - the first international setting in the series, complete with tropical open-world activities, vivid minigames, and unique sidequests. The game also introduces a modernized job/class system, deeper character bonds through the “Drink Links” system, and emergent combat tactics through environmental interaction.

Super Mario Bros. Wonder is a 2D side-scrolling platform game that revitalizes the classic Mario formula with inventive twists and modern polish. Players guide Mario, Luigi, Peach, Daisy, Toad, Toadette, Nabbit, or one of four Yoshi variants through the imaginative Flower Kingdom, aiming to stop Bowser - who has fused with Prince Florian’s castle after wielding the power of the Wonder Flower.Gameplay retains intuitive left-to-right platforming while introducing fresh systems. Players navigate levels filled with familiar enemies and obstacles, collecting Wonder Seeds, power-ups, and badge upgrades. New power-ups include Elephant Fruit, the Bubble Flower, and the Drill Mushroom - each offering unique traversal and combat abilities. Multiplayer supports up to four players, both locally and online, and players earn badges pre-level that modify movement, attacks, or other abilities to shape a customized experience.Distinctive features of Super Mario Bros. Wonder include the transformative Wonder Flower events - one per stage - that dramatically alter level layout, physics, visuals, or character behaviors mid-run, dissolving predictability in favor of surprise. The Badge system encourages strategic variability by granting temporary bonuses like floatier jumps or protective effects. The game design also balances character differences - such as Yoshi being damage-immune and capable of carrying others - making cooperative play more seamless and inclusive, while maintaining fast, dynamic pacing.

Street Fighter 6 is the first title in the long-running fighting game series to take place after the events of Street Fighter III: 3rd Strike. Peace has largely been restored to Metro City but street fights are still a common occurence among the population to the point of becoming a pastime, and the player can enter the storyline either with a custom character seeking to rise in the ranks of street fighters, or play the usual "arcade" mode and follow the stories related to the canon characters (18 at launch, 6 of which entirely new to the series).The game has three main modes:A key addition to Street Fighter 6 are the different control sets: Modern, Classic and Dynamic. Modern is designed to be streamlined and easier to learn for newcomers and Dynamic is designed to perform auto-attacks relative to the player's position towards the opponent, while Classic retains the complexity and depth of controls from prior games in the series. Players can change the control sets at any time and fight against each other offline - with online only permitting Modern and Classic - but the trade-off is that only the Classic controls deal full damage on every hit. The used control set is shown next to the player's name during a match. Multiple common combinations which require pressing multiple keys at once (e.g. Light Punch + Light Kick, all three Punches...) can be mapped to a single separate key as well.The new Drive Gauge, shown beneath the vitality meter, allows execution of moves that rush towards the opponent, parry attacks, counter/absorb incoming hits or overdrive special attacks. It has 6 slots which replenish over time and when normal attacks are performed successfully. Super Arts come in 3 levels, with increasing power and cinematic duration.Additional characters (as they are released post-launch), gear, cosmetics for custom characters and more can be bought from the in-game store or via DLC packages, while the in-game currency can also be earned by playing. Cross-play between platforms can be toggled on and off.

Final Fantasy VII: Rebirth is an action role-playing game and the second full-length installment in Square Enix’s remake trilogy of the original 1997 title, Final Fantasy VII. The game continues the narrative of Cloud Strife and his allies - moving from the confines of Midgar into a much larger world as they pursue Sephiroth and confront revelations about the Planet and their own destinies.Gameplay builds on the real‑time combat hybridized with strategic ATB systems introduced in the previous entry. Players freely switch between party members - using melee, magic, summons, items, and “Synergy” team attacks - to engage enemies. Rebirth expands gameplay with open-world progression, Chocobo-mounted travel, objective-based HUD markers, item crafting via the Transmuter, and weapon Skill systems tied to weapon levels.Final Fantasy VII: Rebirth includes a semi-open world structure that blends narrative chapters with expansive regions to explore, complete with hidden collectibles, sidequests, and mini-games like the new Queen’s Blood card system. Customization depth is increased through skill trees, Synergy attacks for strategic party interplay, and exploratory mechanics such as locating and riding Chocobos obtained per region, which enhance traversal and world engagement.

column1: Tsukihime: A piece of blue glass moon
column3: This remake of the 2000 game Tsukihime is a retelling of the original with entirely new art and a significantly different story, including new characters. Shiki Tohno, heir to the Tohno family, has a strange secret. Following a near-fatal car accident as a child, he's gained the ability to see the threads of fate and foresee anyone's death. After years spent banished to a remote branch family household, he's called back home by his sister where he has to adapt to life back home in the family household.Depending on player choices, the plot can branch. This remake contains the two core "near side of the moon" routes from the original game, with branching plots focusing on two specific characters. In one route, the plot follows Shiki's encounters with a vampire named Arceuid Brunestud and her conflicts with a sect of powerful vampiric foes. In another, he becomes close with his upperclassmate Ciel, who turns out to be a vampire hunter who's targeting a powerful vampire named Roa Valdamjong. The "far side" routes, side stories focusing on other characters, are planned for inclusion in the upcoming game Tsukihime: Another side of red garden.

Donkey Kong Bananza is a 3D platformer where players control Donkey Kong, accompanied by Pauline, as they descend through a subterranean world in search of a mysterious legend said to grant wishes. The game emphasizes exploration, environmental destruction, and fluid movement within large, open-ended levels called “layers”.Gameplay centers around DK's ability to tear, punch, and reshape nearly any part of the environment, offering different approaches to tackle challenges. Chunks of terrain can be pulled from the ground and used as projectiles, surfboards, platforms, or tools for solving puzzles. Visual cues, material interactions or Pauline singing guide player discovery. The moveset includes roll-jumps, wall climbs, and ground slams.Each layer presents different mechanics and environmental materials, such as lava hardening into platforms when struck with ice. Levels contain optional challenge rooms featuring platforming, puzzles, and combat trials. Collectibles include Banandium Gems, fossils, and gold, which unlock cosmetic items and upgrades. Gems also feed into a skill tree that enhances DK's abilities. Progression is mostly linear for the main story, but there is also free exploration with tools like sonar and transformation powers to uncover hidden content.Transformation states, known as Bananzas, grant DK temporary powers like enhanced speed, gliding, or breaking tougher materials. These are powered by a resource called Bananergy. There is a post-game mode and local co-op is supported, allowing Pauline to be controlled by a second player.
This Windows release contains the base game Persona 5: Royal and over 40 pieces of DLC. It is the first release of the game for the platform.

Animal Well is a Metroidvania-style puzzle platformer featuring minimalist environmental narrative and procedural challenge design. The experience unfolds across a mysterious underground labyrinth populated by animals and artifacts - presented without backstory or explicit guidance.Gameplay is structured around exploration through interconnected, flip‑screen rooms that form a 16x16 grid of subterranean chambers. Players control a small blob creature that walks, jumps, and collects quirky tools - such as slinkies, frisbees, or bubble wands - which often have unexpected, multi-purpose uses. Survival hinges on maintaining hearts (gained by finding pink and blue fruits), avoiding hostile creatures and ghosts, and discovering hidden passages unlocked through item usage or environmental interaction.Animal Well features layered gameplay defined by four “layers” of content: the first ending through environmental puzzles; a second “discovery” layer rich with hidden collectibles; a third that introduces ARG-like mechanics requiring real-world collaboration; and a fourth geared toward challenge-run and speedrun puzzles. Each layer deepens the game’s secret ecosystem rather than expanding the world outward. Procedural animation and a handcrafted pixel aesthetic reinforce the uncanny, discovery‑driven experience.

Blue Prince is a puzzle game that places players in the role of the heir to Mt. Holly, a sprawling, mysterious mansion with an ever-shifting floor plan. At the heart of the experience is a central objective: to find the elusive and mythical "Room 46". According to the game’s premise, locating this hidden room grants the player ownership of the entire estate. However, the journey toward Room 46 is neither straightforward nor predictable, as the structure of the house changes each day, making the search into an evolving strategic challenge. The game is inspired by Christopher Manson's 1985 puzzle book Maze.Gameplay in Blue Prince is structured around daily exploration runs through the mansion. Each morning begins in the estate’s central lobby, where players are presented with three sealed doors. Choosing one leads to a draft of three potential rooms, and only one of these can be placed. This room becomes part of the current day’s mansion layout. As the player continues, they add more rooms in this fashion, making strategic decisions about which spaces to include based on available doors, room features, and ongoing goals. Once the day ends—either by exhausting resources or reaching a stopping point—the mansion resets. The player begins the next day anew in the lobby, but with only certain permanent upgrades retained, such as blueprint enhancements or unlocked room types.A core mechanic of the game is the management of footsteps, which represent how far the player can travel during a single day. Each transition from one room to another consumes a footstep, and backtracking consumes additional steps, creating a push-pull between exploration and efficiency. When footsteps run out, the day ends. Another central mechanic involves the use of doors as strategic gateways. Rooms can contain one or more doors, and the player must consider how each room connects to the broader layout. Poor planning can result in cul-de-sacs or dead ends, limiting further expansion and progress toward the ultimate goal.The mansion is also filled with various items and resources that support exploration. Coins, which may be found in decorative environments such as bars or living rooms, can be used in special vendor rooms to purchase helpful tools. Gems allow access to rare and valuable room choices during the drafting phase. Keys serve multiple functions, from opening locked doors to unlocking specific types of rooms or pathways. The interaction between these items and the environment adds complexity and variety to each run. Players may encounter rooms with safes, locked cabinets, or darkened spaces that require light from elsewhere in the house, creating environmental puzzles that often span multiple rooms or runs.While the search for the final room is presented as the main goal, various clues and mechanics become apparent to attentive players, with layers upon layers of puzzles and lore, both inside and outside the house.

Ghost of Tsushima: Director’s Cut is a single-player action game set in feudal Japan. Players resume control of Jin Sakai, a samurai defending Tsushima Island from occupying Mongol forces, now facing new challenges that test his code of honor, adaptability, and leadership.The player navigates a large open world, using horseback travel, grappling hooks for vertical traversal, and the iconic Guiding Wind mechanic to traverse dense forests, temples, and mountain paths. Combat emphasizes skillful timing and stance switching, such as Stone, Water, Wind, and Moon stances - each effective against specific enemy types. Activating Ghost Stance provides temporary invincibility and one-hit kills after filling the resolve meter. Players restore health through hot springs and healing items, increase resolve through successful parries or executions, and earn Technique Points to unlock new skills. Exploration rewards include charms, armor dyes, poetry composing (haiku), and resource-gathering from ledger locations such as Shinto shrines and bamboo strikes.The Director’s Cut adds a new narrative arc on Iki Island, accessible after reaching Act II in the base game. Iki features unique environments, new enemy types, villagers affected by mysterious influences, and game mechanics such as the new Horse Charge ability and weapon charms for parry bonuses. Players collect Iki-specific armor dyes, Records of Iki, and additional side content that deepens Jin’s story and expands the world’s lore.Exclusive to PlayStation 5 are several technical enhancements and accessibility features - dynamic 4K resolution, 60 fps performance, ultra-fast loading, Japanese lip-sync, 3D audio, haptic feedback, adaptive triggers, and expanded photo mode options. On PC, the edition includes unlocked frame rates, ultrawide resolutions, DLSS/FSR upscaling, keyboard/mouse support, and full controller remapping through Steam Input. The expansion remains fully integrated, and save files from the original game can be carried over to continue progression.

Psychonauts 2 is a single-player, 3D action platforming game. The game continues the story of Razputin “Raz” Aquato, a young psychic who has finally joined the international espionage organization known as the Psychonauts. Shortly after his initiation, Raz becomes involved in an investigation to uncover a mole within headquarters and prevent the resurrection of Maligula, a powerful psychic from the organization’s past.The player controls Raz in a story-driven adventure that moves between real-world hub areas and the inner landscapes of various characters’ minds. Each mental world serves as a unique level, designed around the fears, memories, and personalities of its host. Progress through these surreal environments reveals new details about the conspiracy facing the Psychonauts and the struggles of the individuals Raz is trying to help. Outside the minds, players explore the Motherlobe headquarters and surrounding areas, interacting with fellow interns and agents while discovering side quests and secrets.Gameplay combines platforming, combat, and puzzle-solving. Raz performs acrobatic maneuvers such as double jumps, dashes, rope swings, and rail grinds, while also wielding psychic abilities. Returning powers include telekinesis, clairvoyance, pyrokinesis, and levitation, while new abilities such as Mental Connection allow Raz to grapple thought bubbles and alter a character’s associations. Enemies are manifestations of negative emotions, like Censors, Regrets, and Bad Ideas, each with different attack patterns. Combat blends melee strikes with psychic powers, which can be assigned to controller buttons for quick use.Progression is tied to collecting figments, emotional baggage, half-a-minds, and memory vaults hidden in each level. These contribute to raising Raz’s PSI rank, which grants intern credits for upgrading abilities. Collectible PSI cards and challenge markers further increase rank, while in-game currency can be spent on items or on “pins,” modifiers that alter Raz’s abilities or add cosmetic flourishes. Health is measured by brains, and PSI energy powers psychic attacks, both replenished through pickups scattered across levels.Between story missions, players can explore hub areas, interact with NPCs, and complete optional platforming challenges. Side quests provide rewards such as items or resources and expand background details about characters and locations. Exploration also reveals hidden collectibles and minigames. Although the story follows a fixed structure without branching paths, dialogue and character interactions provide humor and context for Raz’s journey.The levels emphasize thematic variety, each representing the host’s unique state of mind. One features a dentist’s nightmare filled with oversized teeth, while another combines a hospital and a casino to reflect compulsive behavior. Boss battles serve as climactic encounters, requiring the use of Raz’s psychic abilities and environmental features to succeed. Some stages temporarily shift mechanics, introducing rhythm sequences or alternate perspectives to keep gameplay varied.Psychonauts 2 runs in third-person perspective with automatic saving across all versions. Completed levels can be revisited once new powers are unlocked, allowing players to collect missed items. The title supports full controller mapping and accessibility settings, and although the story is linear, the design encourages thorough exploration and mastery of Raz’s abilities.

Kingdom Come: Deliverance II is a first-person, open-world action role-playing game deeply rooted in historical realism. The game continues the story of Henry of Skalitz during the turmoil of 15th-century Bohemia, set amid civil war and political intrigue following the events of the original Kingdom Come: Deliverance.Gameplay expands on the immersive systems of its predecessor, offering a world twice as large, now comprising two vast, freely explorable regions - Bohemian Paradise and the city of Kuttenberg. Players navigate using first-person perspective, engage in realism-focused combat with swords, crossbows, and early firearms (some usable on horseback), and influence NPC behavior through expanded dialogue skills such as Appearance, Coercion, and Dominate. Individual actions shape social standing and relationships within the world.Distinctive features include a nuanced skill and decision system that heavily impacts story progression and world reactions - meaning even minor missteps, like mishandling a local dispute, can dramatically alter community relationships and dialogue responses. Combat and AI behavior have been refined for greater realism, while the game’s larger environments introduce new exploration dynamics. Models and lighting receive notable enhancements, reinforcing visual immersion and the game's historical setting. The game also integrates modding support following its launch, paving the way for deeper player customization.

Tekken 8 is a single-player and multiplayer 3D fighting game. It continues the long-running Mishima family saga, focusing on the battle between Kazuya Mishima and his son, Jin Kazama, as the conflict threatens the world. Jin must confront his father’s destructive ambitions while struggling against the Devil Gene within himself. The story mode follows this central conflict through cinematic cutscenes and staged fights, blending narrative and gameplay to advance the plot.The core gameplay remains rooted in one-on-one matches fought in 3D arenas. Players choose from a roster of returning fighters and newcomers, each with unique fighting styles, movesets, and signature abilities. Combat revolves around high, mid, and low attacks, throws, and counters, with victory earned by depleting an opponent’s health bar in two out of three rounds. Movement allows sidesteps and positioning adjustments in 3D space, which adds a layer of tactical depth compared to purely 2D fighters.Tekken 8 introduces the Heat System as its main innovation. Each fighter has access to Heat Burst and Heat Engager attacks that activate a temporary empowered state. While Heat is active, characters gain enhanced properties such as chip damage, new attack options, and altered move animations. Heat can be triggered once per round and must be used strategically, either for immediate offensive pressure or to extend combos. Alongside Heat, mechanics like Rage Arts return, providing cinematic finishing moves when a character’s health is critically low.Progression outside of battle comes through practice modes, tutorials, and character customization. Players can earn fight money to purchase cosmetic items that alter costumes, accessories, and effects without changing gameplay balance. The story mode provides a structured narrative campaign centered on Jin and Kazuya, while side episodes explore other characters’ motivations and rivalries. Arcade Quest serves as an additional mode where players create a customizable avatar and compete across virtual arcades, simulating a progression through Tekken’s competitive history.Online functionality is a major component of the game. Ranked and player matches allow competition worldwide, supported by rollback netcode to ensure smoother connections. Tekken Fight Lounge serves as a multiplayer hub where avatars can interact, train together, and enter matchmaking. Cross-platform play allows users on different systems to fight each other, broadening the player base.Tekken 8 also emphasizes accessibility and secondary systems. A Special Style control scheme simplifies complex commands into single button inputs for casual play, while retaining the traditional scheme for advanced players. Training tools include frame data displays, move lists, and practice features that assist players in learning character strategies. A replay system enables users to watch past matches with data overlays and even take control during playback to practice counters.

Half-Life: Alyx is a first-person VR shooter and a prequel to Half-Life 2, taking place five years before the arrival of Gordon Freeman in City 17. For the first time in the series, the player assumes the role of Alyx Vance, then a 19-year-old member of the Resistance working to subvert the rule of the alien Combine. When Alyx discovers the existence of a vault that supposedly contains a superweapon, she sets out to claim it for the Resistance, setting in motion a chain of events that will have drastic consequences on her future.The game features the classic hallmarks of the Half-Life series: exploration and puzzle-solving within a linear narrative. Unlike Gordon Freeman, Alyx is a voiced protagonist and will comment on her surroundings as well as have audible dialogue with other characters. Her Gravity Gloves, similar to Half-Life 2's Gravity Gun, are used to grab objects from afar and pull them towards the player. Alyx collects weapons throughout the game which can be upgraded at specific Combine upgrade stations; each upgrade costs a different amount of Resin, a resource that can be found throughout most of the game's environments.

It Takes Two is a cooperative-only action platform game. It requires two players at all times, either via local split-screen or online play. A single player cannot complete the game, as each section is designed around both characters contributing simultaneously. The game supports “Friend’s Pass,” allowing one player to invite another online even if they do not own a copy.Cody and May are a married couple on the verge of divorce, whose daughter Rose wishes to keep them together. After making dolls of her parents out of wood and clay, Rose’s tears magically transform them into the toys. The couple awakens in miniature form inside their own home, guided by the eccentric talking Book of Love, authored by Dr. Hakim. To return to their human bodies, Cody and May must work together, overcoming surreal environments that reflect the challenges in their relationship. The story is told through stages that metaphorically explore themes of family, trust, and reconciliation.Gameplay blends multiple genres across its levels. Platforming is the core mechanic, with characters running, jumping, and dashing across elaborate environments. Each level introduces new mechanics, such as rail grinding, shooting sections, puzzle-solving, or environmental manipulation. Boss fights punctuate chapters, requiring both players to use their current abilities in tandem. Minigames are scattered throughout, offering competitive diversions ranging from simple races to rhythm challenges. The dynamic split-screen presentation shifts fluidly to emphasize critical actions, and it remains present even during online co-op. Throughout the campaign, Cody and May gain unique abilities that vary with each chapter, ensuring asymmetrical cooperation - such as one character manipulating time while the other creates clones, or one controlling magnets of opposing polarities.Progression is chapter-based rather than open-ended. Players advance linearly through themed areas representing elements of Cody and May’s lives, such as their garden, attic, and a child’s toy castle. Levels mix environmental hazards with puzzles that can only be solved through communication and coordination. Failure results in quick respawns, keeping the pace consistent and minimizing downtime. There are no collectibles that significantly alter gameplay; instead, exploration rewards players with hidden minigames or playful interactions in the environment.The title does not employ traditional role-playing systems such as character leveling or permanent upgrades. Abilities are reset at the start of each chapter, ensuring that mechanics are tailored to the narrative setting rather than long-term progression. This design choice prevents players from relying on a single set of skills and emphasizes variety across the game’s duration. Each level’s mechanics are supported by highly detailed environments that turn mundane household objects into large-scale playgrounds.Dialogues and cutscenes advance the story between gameplay sections, often featuring arguments between Cody and May or comedic appearances from Dr. Hakim. Player choices do not affect the outcome of the story, as the narrative unfolds in a fixed structure. However, interactive dialogue moments and character banter during gameplay add variety and humor to the journey.

Final Fantasy VII: Remake is a role-playing game and the first episode in Square Enix’s multi-part reimagining of the classic 1997 title, Final Fantasy VII. The story revisits Midgar through the eyes of Cloud Strife, a mercenary entangled with the eco-terrorist group AVALANCHE as they confront the life-draining Shinra Corporation.Gameplay builds a hybrid combat system that blends fast-paced, real-time action with strategic elements inspired by the Active Time Battle (ATB) system. Players can switch between party members - including Cloud, Tifa, Barret, and Aerith - and execute special commands, spells, or items once the ATB gauge fills. The classic materia system returns, enabling players to equip magic, summons, support, and stat-boosting orbs into weapons and armor. Combat is enriched with dodge, parry, and environmental interaction mechanics.The remake includes seamless transitions between exploration and cinematic sequences powered by Unreal Engine 4, bringing Midgar to life with high-fidelity character models, fluid animations, and reactive environments. The materia system is recontextualized to support real-time combat strategy through independent and linked materia configurations. The game also introduces refined pacing through expanded character development, interactive side quests, and modernization touches.

Monster Hunter: Wilds is a single-player and multiplayer action role-playing game. Set in a new frontier known as the Forbidden Lands, players assume the role of a hunter tasked with exploring vast, interconnected environments while maintaining the balance between human settlements and the large monsters that inhabit the region. The narrative follows the expansion of outposts and the growing relationship between hunters and local communities, with story missions centered around investigating the ecology of new creatures and surviving unpredictable changes in the environment.The player enters large open zones without traditional loading screens, traversing deserts, grasslands, and canyons that dynamically shift with weather and time of day. Mounts are introduced as a core travel mechanic, allowing hunters to quickly move across regions, perform mounted attacks, and switch equipment while on the move. Monsters roam freely and behave according to their own routines, with some becoming territorial during certain weather conditions or hunting other species in large-scale encounters.Combat remains centered on real-time melee and ranged weapon classes, including great swords, bows, lances, and dual blades, each with unique combos, charge mechanics, and defensive techniques. Hunters manage stamina for dodging and blocking, sharpen melee weapons during hunts, and use specialized items such as traps, bombs, and healing potions. The new Focus Mode provides lock-on targeting and greater precision in striking monster weak points, while elemental effects and weapon affinities further influence damage output. Dynamic weather events such as sandstorms and thunderstorms alter monster behavior and visibility, forcing players to adapt mid-mission.Progression involves tracking monsters, collecting materials, and returning resources to craft new weapons, armor sets, and upgrades. Armor skills grant passive bonuses, with set bonuses offering specialized builds tailored to specific weapon playstyles. Gathering plants, ores, and monster parts contributes to a resource loop that fuels both personal gear and settlement improvements. Completing hunts grants Hunter Rank and Master Rank progress, which unlock higher-tier challenges and stronger monsters.Multiplayer remains integral, with up to four hunters able to join hunts cooperatively, either by matchmaking or responding to SOS flares. Teamwork is emphasized through stagger mechanics, coordinated traps, and resource sharing. Cross-platform play allows users across different systems to join the same hunts, while scalable difficulty ensures monsters adapt their health and aggression to the number of players in the party.

column1: The Last of Us: Part II
column3: The Last of Us: Part II is a third-person action game with survival horror elements and the sequel to The Last of Us (2013). Set in a post-apocalyptic United States, the game follows Ellie on a brutal quest for revenge and Abby, a soldier caught in a conflict between her militia and a religious cult. The player alternates control between the two protagonists, navigating environments such as ruined cities and dense forests, using firearms, melee weapons, and stealth to survive against both hostile humans and infected creatures.The game introduces enhanced traversal mechanics, allowing players to jump, climb, swim, and use ropes for exploration and combat advantages. Players can shatter glass to access new areas, ride horses or boats, and utilize a deep crafting system to create health kits, silencers, and Molotov cocktails. A skill tree unlocks upgrades to abilities like crafting speed, health, and ammunition types. Workbenches allow weapon customization, enhancing combat effectiveness.Enemies are highly intelligent, calling for reinforcements and using tactics to flank the player. Players must use "Listen Mode" to detect enemy positions and employ a dynamic cover system, crouching or going prone for stealth. Guard dogs track scents, forcing players to constantly reposition. The game also features AI companions, such as Dina, who assist in combat.The story follows Ellie and Abby over multiple timelines. Ellie seeks vengeance after witnessing Joel’s murder at the hands of Abby, who is avenging her father’s death. Their paths intertwine through the war-torn streets of Seattle, culminating in a final confrontation. Themes of trauma, loss, and the cycle of violence drive the narrative.

Xenoblade Chronicles 3 is a single-player role-playing game. The story takes place on the war-torn world of Aionios, where two nations, Keves and Agnus, are locked in perpetual conflict. Soldiers from both sides are created with limited lifespans, raised to fight, and bound to military terms of ten years. The narrative follows six protagonists from opposing factions: Noah, Lanz, and Eunie of Keves, and Mio, Taion, and Sena of Agnus. Forced into cooperation after a failed mission, they discover that their struggle is part of a larger conspiracy tied to mysterious beings known as Moebius. The player guides this group as they seek the truth behind the endless war while battling to extend their lives beyond their predetermined fates.The game is structured around large open areas connected into a seamless world. Exploration is central, with players traveling through plains, mountains, and colonies, engaging both in story-driven missions and optional side quests. Exploration is supported by field skills that allow access to new areas, such as climbing, swimming, or rope sliding, which are unlocked as the story progresses. Combat encounters occur directly in the environment without transitions, allowing for continuous exploration and fighting. Enemies roam openly, and players can choose when to engage or avoid encounters. Combat builds upon the real-time system established in earlier Xenoblade Chronicles entries. Characters auto-attack when in range, while players activate Arts mapped to buttons, each with unique effects, cooldowns, and positional bonuses. The system emphasizes party coordination, with multiple roles: attackers, defenders, and healers.Progression is linked to the flexible class system. Each of the six main characters can adopt different classes, such as Swordfighter, Medic Gunner, or Zephyr, and earn new skills, Arts, and equipment options. Unlocking additional hero characters through quests expands the class selection further. Equipping different combinations of Arts, skills, and accessories lets players customize builds for each encounter.A unique mechanic is the Ouroboros system, where paired characters can fuse into a more powerful form with its own moveset and abilities. Ouroboros transformations are temporary and require careful timing, as they can turn the tide in prolonged battles. Fusion Arts also allow characters to combine two Arts into a single stronger attack, offering strategic depth in combat. Additionally, Xenoblade Chronicles 3 includes colony management, where the player builds relationships with different settlements across Aionios. Side quests range from standard battles and fetch tasks to story-driven arcs that reveal more about each colony’s struggles and governance. Completing these quests can unlock new Heroes, improve supply lines, and expand available resources.

Metroid Dread is a single-player, action 2D-platform game. The story follows Samus Aran as she travels to the remote planet ZDR to investigate a mysterious transmission. Upon arrival, she learns that the planet is overrun by hostile creatures and the deadly E.M.M.I., robotic units once deployed by the Galactic Federation. Stripped of some of her abilities after an encounter with a Chozo warrior, Samus must reclaim her power, unravel the secrets of ZDR, and confront the threat posed by the ancient Chozo civilization.The player explores a large, interconnected world composed of distinct biomes such as caverns, laboratories, lava zones, and underwater areas. Progression is non-linear but gated by obstacles that can only be bypassed once Samus regains specific abilities. Exploration is aided by navigation rooms and map terminals that gradually reveal the structure of each region. Save stations, teleporters, and elevators link the planet’s areas together, allowing fast travel between key locations once discovered.Combat and movement are tightly integrated. Samus wields her Arm Cannon for beam attacks and missiles, and she acquires upgrades that expand her arsenal, such as ice missiles, charge shots, and beam combinations. E.M.M.I. robots patrol designated zones where conventional weapons are ineffective; in these areas, players must use stealth, mobility, and timing to escape. Boss battles punctuate each region, requiring mastery of Samus’s mobility and timing against large enemies with multiple attack phases.Progression follows the established Metroid structure of collecting power-ups that unlock new paths. Familiar abilities such as the Morph Ball, Screw Attack, and Space Jump return, while new powers like the Phantom Cloak allow stealth through temporary invisibility. Each upgrade opens shortcuts or hidden paths in earlier areas, encouraging backtracking to find collectibles like energy tanks and missile expansions. The world is filled with optional secrets that reward careful observation. Multiple endings are unlocked based on completion time and item collection, continuing the tradition of rewarding efficient exploration.

Microsoft Flight Simulator is a realistic, open-world flight simulation game, marking the return of the renowned franchise. Players are invited to pilot a wide range of aircraft - from light planes to wide-body jets - across an authentically rendered Earth, experiencing accurate geography, weather, and aviation procedures within a comprehensive simulator framework.The core gameplay centers around piloting aircraft with realistic flight physics, cockpit instrumentation, and supportive systems such as AI-assisted air traffic control and virtual co-pilots. Training modules, landing challenges, and guided bush trips help new pilots learn takeoff, navigation, and landing mechanics. Flight plans can be mapped anywhere in the world, and real-time meteorological conditions and live air traffic enhance immersion. The game supports both single-player and multiplayer modes, offering experiences from serene discovery flights to instructional simulations.Distinctive features include a fully realized Earth reproduced using live satellite imagery, photogrammetry, and Microsoft Azure cloud technology to generate real-time 3D terrain and atmospheric effects. The in-game world spans cities, geographical landmarks, and over 37,000 handcrafted airports - all populated with dynamic air and ground traffic, volumetric weather, and wildlife that respond to atmospheric conditions. VR support, scalable realism settings, and the ability to tailor assistance levels are also included features.

column1: Ori and the Will of the Wisps
column3: Ori and the Will of the Wisps is a Metroidvania-style action-platformer that blends seamless exploration with a richly emotive setting. Players assume the role of Ori, a guardian spirit, who embarks on a heartfelt journey to rescue Ku the owlet, heal a fractured land, and uncover a deeper destiny.Gameplay centers on traversing a vast, interconnected world populated by platforming challenges and environmental puzzles. Ori gains abilities over time - such as double jump, dash, grapple, burrow, and swim dash - enabling access to previously unreachable areas. The game replaces the first entry’s linear upgrade tree with a flexible shard system: players collect spirit shards scattered throughout the world (and expand shard capacity via hidden combat shrines), equipping enhancements that modify Ori’s combat and traversal capabilities.Features also include Spirit Trials, a competitive time-based challenge system where players race against ghost replays of others to earn rewards and unlock leaderboards. The world unfolds through richly hand-painted art, dynamic lighting, and a fully orchestrated score.

Castlevania: Dominus Collection is a single-player action RPG compilation containing three handheld titles in the long-running Castlevania series:Each game takes place at different points in the series timeline, featuring new protagonists who battle Dracula’s forces using a combination of melee weapons, magic systems, and exploration-based progression.In Castlevania: Dawn of Sorrow, players follow Soma Cruz, a young man with the ability to absorb the souls of defeated monsters. After the defeat of Dracula, a cult seeks to resurrect him, forcing Soma to once again confront his connection to dark powers.Castlevania: Portrait of Ruin centers on Jonathan Morris and Charlotte Aulin during World War II, who explore paintings that serve as alternate dimensions while confronting Dracula’s servants.Castlevania: Order of Ecclesia introduces Shanoa, a member of an organization formed to fight Dracula in his absence, who uses magical glyphs embedded into her body to wield weapons and spells.All three games use a side-scrolling exploration format, often referred to as "Metroidvania" style. Players navigate large, interconnected maps where progress is gated by key abilities or items. Defeating enemies and uncovering hidden rooms expands the maps further, with each title featuring a variety of castle areas, thematic environments, and bosses that must be defeated to advance.This collection adapts the original Nintendo DS games for modern hardware with revised controls and support for both handheld and console play. Dual-screen features from the originals are reworked for a single-screen display, while touch-based mechanics are translated into alternate button inputs. Additional options include multiple difficulty levels, art galleries, and music players that allow players to revisit content from the series.

Forza Horizon 5 is a single-player and multiplayer open-world racing game. The Horizon Festival returns in Mexico, where the player is cast as a rising star invited to expand the festival across a variety of terrains and climates. The story framework is light, serving mainly to contextualize events, expeditions, and showcase races that unlock new festival sites and open up regions of the map. Progress is tied to the player’s growing reputation and influence as they explore, race, and discover the diverse environments of the country.The player drives a wide selection of licensed vehicles across an open-world map that includes deserts, jungles, cities, beaches, mountains, and the active volcano La Gran Caldera. Races take the form of road events, dirt trails, cross-country routes, and street races, each suited to different vehicle classes and handling models. The driving model combines realism with accessibility, allowing use of assists such as braking and traction control, or turning them off for a more simulation-oriented experience. Events include circuit races, point-to-point sprints, speed zones, drift zones, and showcase races against unconventional opponents like trains or aircraft. Progression is linked to the player’s Horizon Adventure campaign, where each activity contributes accolades that unlock new outposts and story-driven expedition events. Completing races, stunts, and discoveries awards experience points, levels, and skill points that can be spent on vehicle-specific perk trees. Credits earned in events or wheelspins are used to purchase new cars, upgrades, or properties that serve as player houses and fast travel points. Seasonal events rotate weekly, tied to an in-game festival playlist that provides exclusive rewards for completing objectives.Vehicle customization is a central system. For over 900 vehicles, players can tune engines, suspension, tires, and aerodynamics, swap body kits, and create custom paint designs. Cars can be upgraded into different performance classes, and community-created tuning setups and liveries are available for download. Each car gains mastery points through driving that unlock bonuses like skill multipliers or free wheelspins. A garage system allows players to store, sort, and manage their growing collection, with more than 500 vehicles available at launch and additional cars added through updates.Multiplayer expands on the open-world setting. Horizon Life integrates other players seamlessly into the map, where they can join convoys, compete in races, or challenge each other in free roam. Competitive options include ranked and unranked racing, team-based Playground Games such as Capture the Flag and Infected, and cooperative Horizon Arcade events that scale to groups of players. The Eliminator, a battle royale mode first introduced in Forza Horizon 4, returns with players upgrading cars as they knock out opponents.The game was expanded in 2025 with new content packs, cars, and festival playlists, continuing the live-service model established in prior entries. Seasonal updates introduce new weather effects, biomes, and long-term challenges, ensuring ongoing variety beyond the base campaign.

column1: The Last of Us: Part I
column3: The Last of Us: Part I is a single-player action game with survival and stealth elements. Set in the United States twenty years after a fungal outbreak devastated humanity, it follows Joel, a smuggler hardened by loss, who is tasked with escorting a teenage girl named Ellie across the country. Ellie is immune to the infection that has destroyed civilization, and their journey forces them to confront hostile survivors and infected creatures alike. The narrative explores their relationship as they traverse ruined cities, quarantine zones, and wilderness while searching for a group known as the Fireflies.Gameplay is presented in third person, combining exploration, stealth, and combat. Players control Joel for most of the game, navigating open-ended environments filled with enemies and supplies. Stealth is often required, as ammunition and resources are limited. Players can choke enemies silently, craft makeshift weapons, and take cover behind objects during firefights. The infected enemies come in several forms, from recently turned Runners to Clickers that rely on echolocation, requiring different strategies to handle. Ellie accompanies Joel throughout most of the journey, assisting in combat by throwing objects at enemies or calling out danger. She also provides narrative context through dialogue during exploration. Certain sequences involve puzzle-like traversal, such as boosting Ellie to reach ladders or using objects to cross water.Combat emphasizes improvisation and resource management. Weapons include pistols, shotguns, rifles, and bows, which can be upgraded using parts found in the environment. Melee combat uses blunt objects such as pipes or baseball bats that degrade with use. Crafting is a core mechanic, allowing the creation of items such as Molotov cocktails, shivs, and health kits from scavenged materials. Players must balance limited resources between offensive and defensive needs.Progression is tied to upgrades. Supplements found throughout the world allow Joel to enhance abilities such as maximum health, crafting speed, and weapon sway. Workbenches provide opportunities to improve weapon performance, such as reload speed, capacity, or stability. Exploration often rewards players with hidden supplies, collectibles, and environmental storytelling that expand the game’s setting.The Last of Us: Part I is a rebuilt version of the original title with updated visuals, enhanced lighting, and revised character models. The core content remains unchanged, including the main story and the standalone prequel expansion Left Behind, which follows Ellie in events that occur before and during the main narrative.

Death Stranding 2: On the Beach is an action game and the sequel to Death Stranding. Set eleven months after the events of the first game, the game follows Sam Porter Bridges, now living in seclusion with Lou in Mexico. When Fragile requests his help to expand the Chiral Network across Mexico and Australia, Sam is drawn back into a mission to reconnect humanity in the wake of continued supernatural threats. Australia, ravaged by environmental disasters and otherworldly entities, serves as the game's primary setting. As Sam and his companions journey across the continent, they face escalating threats from both human and non-human forces, questioning the consequences of reconnecting a fractured world.The game retains the third-person, open-world structure of its predecessor. Gameplay centers on traversal, logistics, and environmental navigation, with players managing cargo distribution and movement across rugged terrain. New to the sequel are expanded delivery systems, more complex terrain deformation, and new tools such as deployable shelters, amphibious vehicles, and enhanced exoskeletons. Players must balance load weight, equipment, and pathfinding as they traverse varied biomes affected by Timefall, a rain that rapidly ages organic material.It also introduces a greater emphasis on combat and player choice, allowing for direct confrontations, stealth tactics, or evasion through difficult terrain. Players can utilize an expanded arsenal of weapons, vehicles, and tools, including customizable vehicles, drones, and experimental equipment like the "blood boomerang". Natural disasters such as earthquakes, sandstorms, and flash floods dynamically alter the environment, affecting traversal and mission planning.A skill system known as the Automated Porter Assistant System (APAS) lets players enhance Sam’s abilities across combat, stealth, and delivery efficiency. Equipment and perks are unlocked by completing missions and side objectives, offering various approaches to gameplay challenges. The social Strand system returns, allowing asynchronous cooperation with other players by constructing infrastructure such as roads, bridges, and a new monorail system, facilitating faster transportation of goods across the continent. Players also have the ability to customize and command automated delivery bots, participate in cooperative missions through temporal anomalies, and explore indoor environments and vertical settlements. The chiral network has evolved into a multidimensional infrastructure, offering expanded narrative paths and player influence over regional development.

Slay the Princess is a single-player narrative-driven visual novel with branching paths and psychological horror elements. The player assumes the role of a nameless protagonist who awakens in a forest clearing with a single task: to slay a princess imprisoned in a cabin deep within the woods. A disembodied narrator insists that this is the only way to prevent the end of the world. The princess, however, pleads for her life and challenges the truth of the narrator’s words, leaving the player to decide whether to trust their guide or the supposed threat before them. Each choice leads to dramatic consequences, shaping both the protagonist’s fate and the unfolding of the story.Gameplay primarily consists of dialogue-driven interactions and branching decision-making. The player navigates through illustrated story sequences, choosing responses in conversations with the narrator, the princess, and at times, other voices that emerge. Unlike traditional role-playing systems, there are no statistics or inventories. Instead, progression is determined entirely by player choice, with each decision opening or closing narrative paths. Outcomes can range from immediate death to altered storylines that persist into subsequent encounters.The game is structured around repeated loops that recall elements of roguelike progression. After each ending, the protagonist reawakens in the forest with fragmented memories of past encounters. This cycle allows the player to approach the princess in new ways, gradually revealing layers of her nature and the true stakes of the encounter. The narrative expands with each iteration, and prior decisions influence how future versions of the story unfold.A key feature of the gameplay is its unreliable guidance. The narrator offers strong direction but can be questioned, defied, or ignored, and the princess’s words often contradict his. As the player pursues different choices, the protagonist’s personality and relationship to both figures evolve, creating multiple branching story arcs. These branching structures include radically different scenarios, transformations of the protagonist, and metaphysical developments that extend beyond the initial premise.The dialogue system is the emphasis rather than traditional combat. Confrontations with the princess are often resolved through persuasion, resistance, or surrender, with violence serving as one possible outcome among many. There are no action-based mechanics, but player agency is tested through repeated moral decisions, trust, and the acceptance or rejection of uncertainty.The game was later expanded with The Pristine Cut, which added new story routes, artwork, and voice content. This edition broadened the scope of available narrative branches and provided more variation in how repeated loops could evolve, ensuring additional replayability across different platforms.

Hi-Fi Rush is a single-player, action rhythm-based brawler. The game follows Chai, a wannabe rock star who volunteers for a corporate experiment and accidentally ends up with a music player fused to his chest. Branded a defect by the corporation that performed the experiment, Chai becomes a target for extermination and must battle his way through company executives, robotic enforcers, and security systems. Along the way he forms a team of allies, each with their own abilities, who join him in resisting the company’s plans.Gameplay centers on rhythm-driven combat where every attack, dodge, and ability is tied to the beat of the soundtrack. Chai wields a makeshift guitar-shaped weapon to perform light and heavy combos. Players are encouraged to time their actions with the background music, as synchronization enhances damage and builds combo multipliers. Even if input is slightly off, the animations align to the beat, ensuring the rhythm is always maintained. Chai’s companions can be summoned mid-fight to exploit enemy weaknesses or trigger puzzle-solving abilities, such as breaking shields or activating distant switches.Progression is structured around mission-based stages, each with distinct environments, hazards, and themed bosses. Defeating enemies rewards gears, a form of currency used to purchase new moves and abilities. Additional upgrades can increase health, special attack capacity, and combat options. The game grades performance after battles and stages based on timing accuracy, combo variety, and damage taken, encouraging replay to improve ranks.Extra modes unlock after completion, such as higher difficulty levels, time-based challenges, and a rhythm tower that tests endurance against waves of enemies.

Chained Echoes is a single-player role-playing game. The story is set on the continent of Valandis, a land scarred by centuries of war between three kingdoms.
